meanings.definition: A large open area of grassland
meanings.sent1: The prairie stretched out endlessly, covered in green grass.
meanings.sent2: The settlers built their homes on the vast prairie.
meanings.sent3: The cows on the prairie had a dance party under the stars.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a prairie of ideas waiting to be explored.
meanings.sent5: The prairie whispered secrets in the wind, carrying stories of the past.

meanings.definition: An extensive, level or slightly undulating, mostly treeless tract of land in the Mississippi valley, characterized by a highly fertile soil and originally covered with coarse grasses
meanings.sent1: The prairie in the Mississippi valley was rich with fertile soil.
meanings.sent2: The pioneers traveled across the vast prairie in search of a new home.
meanings.sent3: The prairie decided to throw a party for all the animals living on it.
meanings.sent4: Her heart was a prairie of emotions, wild and untamed.
meanings.sent5: The prairie bloomed with life, a canvas painted by nature's brush.
